author: COMSOL
description: The classical three-body problem involves the prediction of the trajectories of three point masses under mutual gravitational attraction. In general, the three-body problem has no closed-form analytic solution, but it can be solved numerically if the initial conditions are known. In this example, two periodic solutions to the three-body problem are simulated: the figure-eight configuration and the Lagrange configuration.
label: three_body_problem.mph
